20110121173000.000|20110121173002.000|TR0|for mentors?
20110121173002.000|20110121173004.000|TR0|
20110121173004.000|20110121173007.000|TR0|DAS:  I think particularly for women in 
20110121173007.000|20110121173009.000|TR0|the music industry, it's very important 
20110121173009.000|20110121173011.000|TR0|that we find mentors.  What I try to talk 
20110121173011.000|20110121173014.000|TR0|to a lot of women nowadays about when I 
20110121173014.000|20110121173016.000|TR0|mentor to young women is to not be a 
20110121173016.000|20110121173018.000|TR0|afraid to share a contact, to have high 
20110121173018.000|20110121173021.000|TR0|self-esteem and to respect yourself, and 
20110121173021.000|20110121173023.000|TR0|to not really get caught up in the hype 
20110121173023.000|20110121173025.000|TR0|that's going on, a lot of the gossip.
20110121173025.000|20110121173027.000|TR0|
20110121173027.000|20110121173030.000|TR0|I actually am part of an organization 
20110121173030.000|20110121173032.000|TR0|called WEEN.  It's the Women Entertainment 
20110121173032.000|20110121173034.000|TR0|Empowerment Network.  And we do just that. 
20110121173034.000|20110121173037.000|TR0| We try to uplift one another, we try to 
20110121173037.000|20110121173039.000|TR0|encourage other women, because I think we 
20110121173039.000|20110121173041.000|TR0|would be a lot further along if we weren't 
20110121173041.000|20110121173044.000|TR0|afraid to help each other out.
20110121173044.000|20110121173046.000|TR0|
20110121173046.000|20110121173048.000|TR0|WHITFIELD:  So how involved are you now 
20110121173048.000|20110121173051.000|TR0|with the music industry, and how have you 
20110121173051.000|20110121173053.000|TR0|seen it evolve since your start?
20110121173053.000|20110121173055.000|TR0|
20110121173055.000|20110121173057.000|TR0|DAS: Well, the industry  has changed a 
20110121173057.000|20110121173100.000|TR0|lot.  I actually exited my post at 
20110121173100.000|20110121173102.000|TR0|Universal Motown last November.  I was the 
20110121173102.000|20110121173104.000|TR0|executive vice president of urban 
20110121173104.000|20110121173107.000|TR0|marketing, and the Internet has changed a 
20110121173107.000|20110121173109.000|TR0|lot of what is going on with the 
20110121173109.000|20110121173111.000|TR0|entertainment business.
20110121173111.000|20110121173114.000|TR0|
20110121173114.000|20110121173116.000|TR0|But I still think it is a wonderful 
20110121173116.000|20110121173118.000|TR0|business.  I do entertainment marketing, 
20110121173118.000|20110121173120.000|TR0|consulting now.  I started a live music 
20110121173120.000|20110121173123.000|TR0|showcase now. Particularly, because I 
20110121173123.000|20110121173125.000|TR0|think that some of the live music was lost 
20110121173125.000|20110121173127.000|TR0|within the business.  Everyone has access

20110121173736.000|20110121173739.000|TR0|won his battle with thyroid cancer, and 
20110121173739.000|20110121173741.000|TR0|he's got another triumph.  He's got a 
20110121173741.000|20110121173743.000|TR0|brand new prosthetic chin.  The 68-year- 
20110121173743.000|20110121173745.000|TR0|old lost much of his jaw in his battle

20110121173806.000|20110121173808.000|TR0|Rotter, who crafted Ebert's amazing new 
20110121173808.000|20110121173811.000|TR0|prosthetic chin.  Thank you for joining us.
20110121173811.000|20110121173813.000|TR0|
20110121173813.000|20110121173815.000|TR0|DAVID ROTTER, PROSTHETIST FOR EBERT'S 
20110121173815.000|20110121173818.000|TR0|CHIN: You are welcome.
20110121173818.000|20110121173820.000|TR0|
20110121173820.000|20110121173822.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  So, this prosthetic chin took 
20110121173822.000|20110121173825.000|TR0|two years to develop. Why so long?
20110121173825.000|20110121173827.000|TR0|
20110121173827.000|20110121173829.000|TR0|ROTTER:  The challenge of Roger's 
20110121173829.000|20110121173832.000|TR0|remaining anatomy was pretty daunting.  
20110121173832.000|20110121173834.000|TR0|Basically, his mandible or jawbone was 
20110121173834.000|20110121173836.000|TR0|removed, so there's no anatomical 
20110121173836.000|20110121173838.000|TR0|structure really for the prosthesis to 
20110121173838.000|20110121173841.000|TR0|grab on to.  So kind of over a prolonged 
20110121173841.000|20110121173843.000|TR0|process, what I did is to free-formed a 
20110121173843.000|20110121173845.000|TR0|shape that would be sort of a natural 
20110121173845.000|20110121173848.000|TR0|segue for what he has now.       
20110121173848.000|20110121173850.000|TR0|Prosthesis is not really meant to be a 
20110121173850.000|20110121173852.000|TR0|facsimile of his former self, but more 
20110121173852.000|20110121173855.000|TR0|just a natural continuation of what he 
20110121173855.000|20110121173857.000|TR0|currently looks like now.
20110121173857.000|20110121173859.000|TR0|
20110121173859.000|20110121173901.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  And through those two years, 
20110121173901.000|20110121173904.000|TR0|there were a lot of hits and misses.  Tell 
20110121173904.000|20110121173906.000|TR0|us about the misses and what you had to 
20110121173906.000|20110121173908.000|TR0|fix?
20110121173908.000|20110121173911.000|TR0|
20110121173911.000|20110121173913.000|TR0|ROTTER:  Sure.  First of all, the actual 
20110121173913.000|20110121173915.000|TR0|plastics that I used, the materials that I 
20110121173915.000|20110121173918.000|TR0|used, that was a little bit of a hit and 
20110121173918.000|20110121173920.000|TR0|miss. It was trial and error to try to 
20110121173920.000|20110121173922.000|TR0|find the right material to be both 
20110121173922.000|20110121173925.000|TR0|supportive and comfortable.  That's really 
20110121173925.000|20110121173927.000|TR0|why the process took as long as it did.  
20110121173927.000|20110121173929.000|TR0|And we were really shooting for, you know 
20110121173929.000|20110121173931.000|TR0|a beautiful device that would look great 
20110121173931.000|20110121173934.000|TR0|on television, and I think that we are 
20110121173934.000|20110121173936.000|TR0|proud of what we finally came up with.
20110121173936.000|20110121173938.000|TR0|
20110121173938.000|20110121173941.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  I was reading his blog, and he

20110121174120.000|20110121174122.000|TR0|COSTELLO: Oh, that is terrific.  David

20110121175224.000|20110121175226.000|TR0|kind of a difficult thing. You're trying 
20110121175226.000|20110121175228.000|TR0|to get a better job. So what enables you 
20110121175228.000|20110121175231.000|TR0|to do that is really important. But at the 
20110121175231.000|20110121175233.000|TR0|same time you cannot be behind on your 
20110121175233.000|20110121175235.000|TR0|bills. I don't necessarily want him to be 
20110121175235.000|20110121175237.000|TR0|pre-paying the bills, but getting your 
20110121175237.000|20110121175240.000|TR0|bills up to date will make a lot of sense.
20110121175240.000|20110121175242.000|TR0|
20110121175242.000|20110121175244.000|TR0|Look, if your rates all of a sudden kicked 
20110121175244.000|20110121175247.000|TR0|up to 30 percent and you start paying late 
20110121175247.000|20110121175249.000|TR0|fees and late penalties, that's going to 
20110121175249.000|20110121175251.000|TR0|erode the increase in earnings you're 
20110121175251.000|20110121175254.000|TR0|going to have by getting another job. So 
20110121175254.000|20110121175256.000|TR0|get them up to date and then try to save
